intro: Deyeuxia sylvatica var. collina, commonly known as the mountain sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or mountainous areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. It is often found in shaded environments and is adapted to cooler climates. Its botanical features make it an important component of ecological systems in its native habitats.
